column4: I need to mount a RAID10 mdadm array in a live CD so I can access my files. But I can't work out how to do it
but i worry that if I run the command it might wipe my array, just wanting someone to confirm it if possible :)
when I run mdadm --assemble --scan it misses out one drive (/dev/sdb1)
but the drive is fine, shows up with fdisk fine
so i think maybe the manual command (with the list of drives) is what I want instead of the auto scan (from --scan)
well I think I'm going to try this command: "mdadm --assemble /dev/md0 --level=raid10 --raid-devices=4 /dev/sda1 /dev/sdb1 /dev/sdc1 /dev/sdd1".... hopefully nothing goes wrong )
they are the right drives and partitions, right raid level (10) and the right number of devices (4). Just not sure on the --assemble bit as to what it means :)
assemble just assembles an existing array from the different components. if the components didn't match up it would complain

ok thank you. actually I was having a problem with /dev/sdb1 not appearing in raid array. I can see why now, because /proc/mdstat has /dev/dsb1 as inactive listed as /dev/md_d0 (it must have been auto detected, because I have not instructed mdadm.conf to do anything with my raid drives). I have just run mdadm --stop /dev/md_d0 and it stopped it. Now I'm going to try the assemble command.
the array should have information in it about what level it is and the uuids of the other disks so the level is superfluous
I'll try omitting the level thanks
I omitted the options and it worked, but I still have the same problem. "mdadm: /dev/md0 has been started with 3 drives (out of 4). "
it may be rejecting the drive for some reason (stale timestamp or hardware failure)
yes it must be. For some reason /dev/sdb1 is listed separately in /proc/mdstat. It has "md0 : active raid10 sda1[0] sdd1[3] sdc1[2] "   and "md_d0 : inactive sdb1[1](S)"
